qbraid.devices.aws package¶

Submodules¶

qbraid.devices.aws.device module¶

BraketDeviceWrapper Class

class BraketDeviceWrapper(name, provider, **fields)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.device.DeviceLikeWrapper

Wrapper class for Amazon Braket Device objects.

Create a BraketDeviceWrapper

Parameters

  • name (str) – a Braket supported device

  • provider (str) – the provider that this device comes from

  • fields – Any kwarg options to pass to the backend for running the config. If a key is also present in the options attribute/object then the expectation is that the value specified will be used instead of what’s set in the options object.

Raises

DeviceError – if input field not a valid options

get_sampler(braket_default=False, embedding=True)[source]¶

Returns BraketSampler created from device. Only compatible with D-Wave devices.

Parameters

  • braket_default (optional, bool) – If True, returns default BraketSampler. Defaults to False, returning BraketDWaveSampler.

  • embedding (optional, bool) – If True, uses EmbeddingComposite to automatically map the problem to the structure of the solver. If False, returns as sampler as-is.

Returns

Sampler derived from device

Raises

DeviceError if not a D-Wave annealing device. –

run(run_input, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Run a quantum task specification on this quantum device. A task can be a circuit or an annealing problem.

Parameters

  • run_input (Union[Circuit, Problem]) – Specification of a task to run on device.

  • kwargs – shots (int): The number of times to run the task on the device.

Returns

The job like object for

the run.

Return type

BraketQuantumTaskWrapper

qbraid.devices.aws.job module¶

BraketQuantumtaskWrapper Class

class BraketQuantumTaskWrapper(device, quantum_task)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.job.JobLikeWrapper

Wrapper class for Amazon Braket QuantumTask objects.

Create a BraketQuantumTaskWrapper

Parameters

  • device – the BraketDeviceWrapper associated with this quantum task i.e. job

  • quantum_task (QuantumTask) – a braket QuantumTask object used to run circuits.

property job_id¶

Return a unique id identifying the task.

metadata(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get task metadata.

Parameters

**kwargs –

use_cached_value (bool, optional): If True, uses the value retrieved from the

previous request.

Returns

The metadata regarding the job. If use_cached_value is True, then the value retrieved from the most recent request is used.

Return type

Dict[str, Any]

result()[source]¶

Return the results of the job.

Return type

Union[AnnealingQuantumTaskResult, GateModelQuantumTaskResult]

async_result()[source]¶

asyncio.Task: Get the quantum task result asynchronously.

Return type

Task

cancel()[source]¶

Cancel the quantum task.

status()[source]¶

State of the quantum task

Return type

str

qbraid.devices.aws.result module¶

BraketGateModelResult Class

class BraketGateModelResultWrapper(gate_model_result)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.result.ResultWrapper

Wrapper class for Amazon Braket GateModelQuantumTaskResult objects.

Create new Braket result wrapper

Parameters

gate_model_result (GateModelQuantumTaskResult) – a Braket Result object

property measurements: numpy.ndarray¶

2d array - row is shot and column is qubit. Default is None. Only available when shots > 0. The qubits in measurements are the ones in GateModelQuantumTaskResult.measured_qubits.

Return type

ndarray

data(**kwargs)[source]¶

Return the raw data associated with the run/job.
